name: Alex Johnson
chief_complaint: Acute on chronic low back pain for 2 weeks after lifting a heavy box. Worse with prolonged sitting, improved somewhat by walking.
history: No red flag history. Prior similar episodes x3 over 5 years. No surgeries. Occasional NSAID use. Desk job. Exercises irregularly.
red_flags: Denies fever, weight loss, cancer history, trauma, bowel/bladder changes, saddle anesthesia, progressive neuro deficit.
vitals: BP 118/74, HR 68, RR 14, afebrile. Antalgic posture, decreased lumbar flexion/extension. TTP paraspinals L>R, no midline tenderness.
goals: Return to pain-free lifting and uninterrupted sleep; reduce pain to <2/10 within 2 weeks.
biomechanical: Lumbar SD: L3-5 NSlRr, restricted extension. Pelvis: right anterior innominate. Sacrum: left-on-left torsion. Thoracolumbar fascia tight.
respiratory: Diaphragm restriction right hemidiaphragm, decreased rib 11-12 motion. Lymphatic congestion mild in lumbar region.
metabolic: Poor sleep, moderate stress, suboptimal hydration. No systemic inflammatory signs.
neurological: Hypertonic paraspinals with trigger points, increased sympathetic tone to lumbar segments.
behavioral: Sedentary work, stress from deadlines, fear-avoidance behaviors with lifting. Interested in ergonomic coaching.
